name: cfrethrow
description:
Rethrows the currently active exception. Preserves the
 exception's `cfcatch.type` and `cfcatch.tagContext` variable
 values.

example.title: Using rethrow to dump a file's contents
example.description: uses a try/catch to read a file,  recreates it if it does not exist, then tries again with rethrow
example.code:
<cfscript>
path="test.txt";
try {
	dump(fileRead(path));
}
catch(e) {
	if(!fileExists(path)) {
		fileWrite(path,"content of the file");
		retry;
	}
	echo(e);
}
if(fileExists(path)) fileDelete(path);
</cfscript>
